alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 10:22PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Grafton County through 1100 PM EDT... At 1022 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Haverhill to 8 miles south of Piermont to near Norwich. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Plymouth, Hanover, Haverhill, Canaan, Franconia, Groton, Woodstock, Piermont, Lyme, Benton, Dorchester, Easton, Ellsworth, Wentworth, Rumney, Campton, Warren, Thornton, and Orford. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 82 and 106. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
